current_task.title: Update UI components for LiveKit tracks
current_task.description:
Update Room.jsx and related components to use useRoom instead of useMediasoup.

**Context:**
Room.jsx currently imports and uses useMediasoup for all WebRTC functionality. We need to replace this with useRoom (LiveKit-based). The API surfaces are similar but have different naming conventions.

**Mapping from useMediasoup to useRoom:**
- `producers` -> `localTracks` (Map of local tracks by sid)
- `consumers` -> `remoteTracks` (Map of remote tracks by sid)
- `peers` -> `participants`
- `initDevice` -> (not needed, room handles device init)
- `captureScreen` + `produceScreen` -> `publishScreen`
- `switchScreenSource` -> `switchScreenSource` (same)
- `changeQuality` -> `changeQuality` (same)
- `startWebcam` -> `publishWebcam`
- `startMic` -> `publishMic`
- `stopProducer` -> `unpublishScreen`, `unpublishMic`, `unpublishWebcam`
- `consumeProducer` -> (automatic in LiveKit)
- `setPeers` -> `setParticipants`
- `availableScreens` -> `availableScreens` (same)
- `watchedScreens` -> `watchedScreens` (same)
- `loadingScreens` -> `loadingScreens` (same)
- `watchScreen` -> `watchScreen` (same)
- `unwatchScreen` -> `unwatchScreen` (same)

**Implementation steps:**

1. Update Room.jsx imports:
   - Remove: `import { connectSocket, disconnectSocket, socketRequest } from '../lib/socket';`
   - Remove: `import { useMediasoup } from '../hooks/useMediasoup';`
   - Add: `import { useRoom } from '../hooks/useRoom';`

2. Replace useMediasoup destructuring with useRoom:
   - Update all variable names per mapping above
   - `isReady` and `error` remain the same

3. Update connection logic:
   - Remove Socket.io connect/disconnect code from useEffect
   - Add call to `connectRoom(roomName, displayName)` where displayName comes from sessionStorage 'hush_displayName'
   - Remove `initDevice()` call (not needed)
   - Remove `socketRequest('getPeers')` and related peer iteration (LiveKit handles this automatically)
   - Update cleanup to call `disconnectRoom()`

4. Update screen share handlers:
   - `handleScreenShare`: Replace `captureScreen` + `produceScreen` + `stopProducer` with `publishScreen` / `unpublishScreen`
   - `handleSwitchSource`: Keep using `switchScreenSource`
   - `handleQualityChange`: Keep using `changeQuality`

5. Update mic/webcam handlers:
   - Replace `startMic`/`stopProducer` pattern with `publishMic`/`unpublishMic`
   - Replace `startWebcam`/`stopProducer` pattern with `publishWebcam`/`unpublishWebcam`

6. Update stream rendering:
   - Check how `producers`/`consumers` are iterated and update to use `localTracks`/`remoteTracks`
   - Each track entry has `{ track, source }` for local or `{ track, participant, kind, source }` for remote
   - Track objects have `.mediaStreamTrack` for the actual MediaStreamTrack
   - For video: `track.attach()` returns an HTMLVideoElement or use `track.mediaStreamTrack` with srcObject

7. Update StreamView.jsx:
   - Currently receives a `stream` or `track` prop
   - LiveKit tracks use `.attach()` method or `.mediaStreamTrack` for srcObject
   - Update to handle LiveKit track objects

8. Update ScreenShareCard.jsx:
   - Should work with availableScreens/watchedScreens/loadingScreens (API unchanged)

9. Update Controls.jsx:
   - Should work unchanged as it receives callbacks from Room.jsx

**Important:**
- Do NOT delete useMediasoup.js yet (that's task B2.4)
- Do NOT remove socket.js yet (that's task B2.4)
- Focus only on making Room.jsx work with useRoom
acceptance_criteria: Room.jsx imports useRoom instead of useMediasoup
connectRoom called with roomName and displayName from sessionStorage

task_queue.title: Milestone B Checkpoint
task_queue.description: Verify: login -> create/join room -> screen share via LiveKit -> voice/video E2EE -> chat via Matrix -> no Socket.io

completed_tasks.title: Add Synapse + PostgreSQL to docker-compose
completed_tasks.review_notes: All acceptance criteria met. PostgreSQL 16-alpine with proper healthcheck, Synapse with depends_on condition: service_healthy, homeserver.yaml template with E2EE enabled, executable setup script, environment variables for all secrets.

completed_tasks.title: Add reverse proxy config (Caddy) to docker-compose
completed_tasks.review_notes: All 7 acceptance criteria verified. Caddyfile properly routes /_matrix/* to synapse:8008 and /* to hush:3001. WebSocket headers preserved via header_up directives. CORS configured with wildcard origin and OPTIONS preflight handling. Caddy service in docker-compose with ports 80/443, depends_on synapse and hush. Direct hush port exposure removed. Caddy volumes declared for persistence.

completed_tasks.title: Verify Synapse health check and guest registration
completed_tasks.review_notes: All 6 acceptance criteria verified. Docker healthcheck uses curl to /health endpoint with 30s interval, 10s timeout, 5 retries, 60s start_period. Test script implements 3 functions: test_health_check (120s polling), test_client_versions (JSON validation), test_guest_registration (handles both 200 and 403 responses). Color-coded output, test counters, proper exit codes. Script is executable (-rwxr-xr-x).

completed_tasks.title: Install matrix-js-sdk and create matrixClient.js
completed_tasks.review_notes: All 6 acceptance criteria verified: (1) matrix-js-sdk ^40.3.0-rc.0 in client/package.json line 12; (2) client/src/lib/matrixClient.js exists with module-level singleton (matrixClient = null); (3) exports createMatrixClient, getMatrixClient, destroyMatrixClient; (4) 3-tier homeserver URL fallback: options.baseUrl || VITE_MATRIX_HOMESERVER_URL || origin/_matrix; (5) client/.env.example created with VITE_MATRIX_HOMESERVER_URL; (6) build succeeds with no errors. Clean implementation following socket.js singleton pattern.

completed_tasks.title: Create useMatrixAuth hook
completed_tasks.review_notes: All 9 acceptance criteria verified: (1) client/src/hooks/useMatrixAuth.js exists; (2) Named export useMatrixAuth(); (3) Returns all 10 fields including 4 functions and 6 state values; (4) loginAsGuest reads localStorage 'hush_displayName' and calls registerGuest with initial_device_display_name; (5) After registration, stores credentials, recreates authenticated client, starts sync with initialSyncLimit 20; (6) logout calls destroyMatrixClient and clears userId/accessToken/deviceId; (7) isAuthenticated = userId !== null && accessToken !== null; (8) Error state captures failures in try-catch blocks; (9) All 4 functions wrapped in useCallback. Clean implementation following useDevices.js pattern. Future-use login/register functions properly implemented.

completed_tasks.title: Update Home.jsx for Matrix auth
completed_tasks.review_notes: All 10 acceptance criteria verified: (1) useMatrixAuth hook imported at line 5; (2) getMatrixClient imported at line 6; (3) loginAsGuest() called at line 274 before API calls; (4) createRoom() called for 'create' mode with E2EE (m.megolm.v1.aes-sha2) at lines 285-297; (5) joinRoom() called for 'join' mode with room alias at lines 298-302; (6) matrixRoomId stored in sessionStorage at line 306; (7) Existing API calls preserved at lines 308-329 with comment noting temporary nature; (8) matrixError displayed in error div at lines 483-485; (9) Both loading states reflected in button at lines 534 and 537; (10) Build succeeded (2.27s, 8 chunks). Minor note: lines 276-278 have redundant matrixError check (errors thrown by loginAsGuest are caught by outer try-catch), but does not affect functionality.

completed_tasks.title: Create Matrix-to-JWT bridge for Socket.io
completed_tasks.review_notes: SKIPPED - Task unnecessary. The existing /api/rooms/create and /api/rooms/join endpoints already generate JWTs for Socket.io/mediasoup. The client already calls these endpoints in handleSubmit (Home.jsx lines 308-329), stores the JWT in sessionStorage (line 327), and uses it for Socket.io auth. No additional bridge layer needed.

completed_tasks.title: Rewrite Chat.jsx for Matrix timeline
completed_tasks.review_notes: All 10 acceptance criteria verified: (1) getMatrixClient imported at line 2; (2) RoomEvent and EventType imported at line 3; (3) matrixRoomId retrieved from sessionStorage at line 144; (4) Existing messages loaded from getLiveTimeline() at lines 159-170 with EventType.RoomMessage filtering; (5) RoomEvent.Timeline listener added at line 188; (6) Cleanup function at lines 190-192; (7) sendMessage uses client.sendMessage() at lines 212-215; (8) All Socket.io code removed from Chat.jsx and Room.jsx (chatMessages state, messageReceived listener, messages prop); (9) Message objects include id, sender, displayName, content, timestamp at lines 163-169; (10) Build succeeds. Note: currentPeerId prop still passed to Chat but unused - minor dead code, harmless.

completed_tasks.title: Remove Socket.io chat events from server
completed_tasks.review_notes: All 11 acceptance criteria verified: (1) messageTimestamps Map declaration removed - grep returns no matches; (2) socket.on('sendMessage', ...) handler removed - grep returns no matches; (3) messageTimestamps.delete(peerId) removed - grep returns no matches; (4) All mediasoup handlers preserved (getRouterRtpCapabilities line 35, createWebRtcTransport line 47, connectTransport line 82, produce line 97, consume line 142, resumeConsumer line 201, closeProducer line 217, updateProducerAppData line 237); (5) getPeers handler preserved (line 261); (6) e2eKeyExchange handler preserved (line 272); (7) peerJoined and peerLeft events preserved (lines 295, 300); (8-10) No references to messageTimestamps, sendMessage, or messageReceived remain; (11) Server syntax check passes. Clean removal of all chat code.

completed_tasks.title: Test chat persistence and encryption
completed_tasks.review_notes: All 9 acceptance criteria verified: (1) scripts/test-chat.sh exists, -rwxr-xr-x; (2) test_guest_registration extracts access_token/user_id lines 67-99; (3) test_create_encrypted_room uses preset: private_chat + initial_state with m.room.encryption lines 101-150; (4) test_send_message uses PUT /rooms/{roomId}/send/m.room.message/{txnId} lines 152-191; (5) test_message_persistence fetches timeline with dir=b&limit=10, verifies message exists lines 193-227; (6) test_encryption_state verifies algorithm is m.megolm.v1.aes-sha2 lines 229-263; (7) Color-coded output (GREEN/RED/YELLOW) lines 8-12, 31-43; (8) Exit code 0 on success, 1 on failure lines 291-301; (9) MATRIX_URL configurable via env var line 15. Clean implementation following test-synapse.sh patterns.

completed_tasks.title: Milestone A Checkpoint - Integration Verification
completed_tasks.review_notes: MILESTONE A APPROVED. All 5 acceptance criteria verified: Docker services healthy, test scripts executed (minor parsing bugs but API verified manually), all core Matrix functionality working (guest/user registration, encrypted rooms, message persistence, E2EE). Configuration issues fixed during checkpoint. Non-blocking: test script variable name bugs. Ready for Milestone B.

completed_tasks.title: Add LiveKit Server + Redis to docker-compose
completed_tasks.review_notes: All 9 acceptance criteria verified: (1) Redis service with redis:7-alpine, appendonly persistence, healthcheck via redis-cli ping; (2) LiveKit service with livekit/livekit-server:latest, config mounted at /etc/livekit.yaml; (3) livekit.yaml has Opus 48kbps audio, H264/VP8/VP9 video codecs; (4) Ports: 7880 WS, 7881 RTC, 50000-60000 UDP; (5) Redis at redis:6379; (6) Keys use ${LIVEKIT_API_KEY}: ${LIVEKIT_API_SECRET} env substitution; (7) .env.example has LIVEKIT_API_KEY/SECRET with placeholder values; (8) depends_on redis with service_healthy; (9) Explicit port mapping for service isolation. Clean implementation.

completed_tasks.title: Create LiveKit token service endpoint
completed_tasks.review_notes: All 10 acceptance criteria verified: (1) livekit-server-sdk ^2.15.0 in server/package.json:16; (2) server/src/livekit/tokenService.js exists with 35 lines; (3) generateToken(roomName, participantIdentity, participantName) signature; (4) Returns token.toJwt() at line 33; (5) Grants include room, roomJoin, canPublish, canSubscribe, canPublishData (lines 25-31); (6) Uses LIVEKIT_API_KEY/SECRET from process.env with validation (lines 13-18); (7) POST /api/livekit/token at lines 162-187 in index.js; (8) Parameter validation returns 400 if missing (lines 167-171); (9) Returns {token} on success or {error} on failure; (10) Server starts without errors. Import alias avoids conflict with auth.js generateToken. Clean implementation.

completed_tasks.title: Update reverse proxy for LiveKit routing
completed_tasks.review_notes: All 6 acceptance criteria verified: (1) handle /livekit/* block at lines 38-50, positioned after Matrix (12-36) and before Hush catch-all (53-64); (2) reverse_proxy to livekit:7880 at line 40; (3) WebSocket headers preserved via header_up Connection/Upgrade at lines 42-43; (4) X-Forwarded-* headers at lines 46-48; (5) Caddy config validated with caddy fmt, container restarted successfully with no errors; (6) Existing Matrix and Hush routes unchanged. Clean implementation following existing route patterns.

completed_tasks.title: Create useRoom hook for LiveKit
completed_tasks.review_notes: All 11 acceptance criteria verified: (1) livekit-client ^2.17.1 in client/package.json:12; (2) client/src/hooks/useRoom.js exists (799 lines); (3) connectRoom fetches token from /api/livekit/token lines 107-122, connects via room.connect() line 264; (4) publishScreen with Track.Source.ScreenShare lines 364-372; (5) publishMic line 622-623, publishWebcam line 558-559 with correct Track.Source; (6) remoteTracks from TrackSubscribed lines 182-193; (7) participants from ParticipantConnected/Disconnected lines 141-178; (8) availableScreens from TrackPublished for screen shares lines 216-228; (9) watchScreen subscribes line 677; (10) all functions wrapped in useCallback; (11) build succeeds. Minor: setParticipants naming collision line 749-751 (non-blocking, dead code).

completed_tasks.title: Preserve noise gate with LiveKit
completed_tasks.review_notes: All 8 acceptance criteria verified: (1) noiseGateWorklet.js loaded via audioWorklet.addModule() at lines 659-661; (2) AudioContext created and stored in audioContextRef at lines 647-648; (3) MediaStreamAudioSourceNode created at line 650; (4) AudioWorkletNode('noise-gate-processor') created at lines 664-667, stored in noiseGateNodeRef; (5) Audio routing source->worklet->destination at lines 674-675; (6) Processed track from destination.stream published to LiveKit at lines 702-708; (7) cleanupMicPipeline() called in unpublishMic (744), disconnectRoom (319), and unmount effect (857); (8) Build succeeds with expected worklet warning. Note: Worklet path './noiseGateWorklet.js' matches existing useMediasoup.js pattern - this is a pre-existing issue where the actual file is at '../lib/noiseGateWorklet.js'. Non-blocking as existing code has same path.

last_architect_output: Iteration 15 -> Task B2.2 APPROVED. All 8 acceptance criteria verified: noiseGateWorklet.js loaded via audioWorklet.addModule(), AudioContext created and stored in ref, MediaStreamAudioSourceNode from mic stream, AudioWorkletNode('noise-gate-processor') created, audio routing source->worklet->MediaStreamDestination, processed track published to LiveKit, cleanupMicPipeline() called in 3 locations (unpublishMic, disconnectRoom, unmount), build succeeds. Pre-existing issue noted: worklet path './noiseGateWorklet.js' should be '../lib/noiseGateWorklet.js' but matches existing useMediasoup.js pattern - not blocking. Proceeding to B2.3: Update Room.jsx and StreamView.jsx to use useRoom instead of useMediasoup.
last_programmer_output:
Task B2.3 completed successfully. All 11 acceptance criteria met:

**1. Room.jsx imports useRoom instead of useMediasoup (✓)**
- Line 4: import { useRoom } from '../hooks/useRoom'
- Line 3: import { Track } from 'livekit-client' for Track.Source constants
- Old import removed: useMediasoup from '../hooks/useMediasoup'

**2. Room.jsx no longer imports connectSocket/disconnectSocket/socketRequest (✓)**
- All Socket.io imports removed from line 3
- Verified with grep: no references to connectSocket, disconnectSocket, socketRequest

**3. connectRoom called with roomName and displayName from sessionStorage (✓)**
- Lines 235-242: connectRoom(roomName, displayName) called in useEffect
- Line 237: displayName = sessionStorage.getItem('hush_displayName') || 'Anonymous'
- roomName from useParams() hook (line 176)
- Error handling for connection failures (lines 243-247)

**4. disconnectRoom called in cleanup (✓)**
- Line 253: disconnectRoom() called in useEffect cleanup function
- Line 378: disconnectRoom() called in handleLeave
- Lines 379-382: sessionStorage cleanup after disconnect

**5. Screen share uses publishScreen/unpublishScreen (✓)**
- Line 272: await unpublishScreen() when stopping screen share
- Line 286: const stream = await publishScreen(qualityKey) when starting
- Lines 289-292: Track 'ended' event listener to update UI state
- handleQualityPick simplified from captureScreen + produceScreen pattern

**6. Microphone uses publishMic/unpublishMic (✓)**
- Line 303: await unpublishMic() when turning mic off
- Line 310: await publishMic(selectedMicId) when turning mic on
- Line 318: await publishMic(deviceId) in handleMicDevicePick
- Line 345: await unpublishMic() in handleMicDeviceSwitch

**7. Webcam uses publishWebcam/unpublishWebcam (✓)**
- Line 324: await unpublishWebcam() when turning webcam off
- Line 330: await publishWebcam(selectedWebcamId) when turning webcam on
- Line 338: await publishWebcam(deviceId) in handleWebcamDevicePick
- Line 354: await unpublishWebcam() in handleWebcamDeviceSwitch

**8. localTracks rendered correctly (screen share preview) (✓)**
- Lines 444-465: Iterate over localTracks.entries()
- Filter for video tracks (info.track.kind === 'video')
- Pair screen video with screen audio if source === MEDIA_SOURCES.SCREEN
- Extract MediaStreamTrack via info.track.mediaStreamTrack for StreamView
- Label: 'Your Screen' for SCREEN, 'Your Webcam' for WEBCAM

**9. remoteTracks rendered correctly (remote video/audio) (✓)**
- Lines 476-519: Iterate over remoteTracks.entries()
- Filter for video tracks (info.kind === 'video')
- Pair video with audio based on Track.Source (ScreenShare->ScreenShareAudio, Camera->Microphone)
- Extract MediaStreamTrack via info.track.mediaStreamTrack for StreamView
- Label from info.participant.name || info.participant.identity
- Lines 521-526: Orphan audio tracks collected for OrphanAudio component

**10. availableScreens/watchedScreens click-to-watch still works (✓)**
- Lines 528-537: Derive unwatchedScreens from availableScreens Map
- Filter for Track.Source.ScreenShare and !watchedScreens.has(trackSid)
- Lines 619-626: Render ScreenShareCard for each unwatched screen
- onWatch={() => watchScreen(screen.producerId)} callback
- isLoading={loadingScreens.has(screen.producerId)} state

**11. Build succeeds with no errors (✓)**
- Build completed in 2.55s
- 10 chunks generated
- Expected warning: "new URL('./noiseGateWorklet.js', import.meta.url) doesn't exist at build time"
- No build errors, all acceptance criteria verified

**Files Modified:**

1. client/src/pages/Room.jsx:
   - Line 3: Added import { Track } from 'livekit-client'
   - Line 4: Changed import to useRoom from '../hooks/useRoom'
   - Lines 190-211: Updated destructuring from useMediasoup to useRoom (localTracks, remoteTracks, participants, connectRoom, disconnectRoom, publishScreen, unpublishScreen, publishMic, unpublishMic, publishWebcam, unpublishWebcam)
   - Lines 226-255: Replaced Socket.io connection logic with LiveKit connectRoom/disconnectRoom
   - Lines 270-294: Updated handleScreenShare and handleQualityPick to use publishScreen/unpublishScreen
   - Lines 301-358: Updated handleMic/handleWebcam and device pick handlers to use publish*/unpublish* pattern
   - Line 378: Updated handleLeave to call disconnectRoom
   - Lines 442-526: Rewrote stream rendering to iterate localTracks/remoteTracks Maps
   - Lines 528-537: Updated unwatched screens logic for Track.Source.ScreenShare
   - Line 581: Updated participant count to participants.length + 1
   - Lines 640-651: Updated participants sidebar to map over participants array

2. client/src/hooks/useRoom.js:
   - Lines 838-841: Removed dead code setParticipants wrapper function
   - Line 884: Removed setParticipants from exports
   - Fixed ESLint error: "The symbol 'setParticipants' has already been declared"

**Implementation Notes:**
- StreamView.jsx requires MediaStreamTrack objects, so we use info.track.mediaStreamTrack from LiveKit tracks
- Track.Source constants used for pairing video/audio (ScreenShare->ScreenShareAudio, Camera->Microphone)
- Participants state managed internally by useRoom via ParticipantConnected/Disconnected events
- Click-to-watch feature preserved: availableScreens populated from TrackPublished events, watchScreen calls publication.setSubscribed(true)
- All Socket.io code completely removed from Room.jsx
- useMediasoup.js and socket.js NOT deleted (as specified - that's task B2.4)
- Code follows CLAUDE.md standards: Single Responsibility, clear variable names, proper error handling
